acceptLanguage.description: Language code. Valid values: `en` (English), `jp` (Japanese), `zh` (Chinese). The default value is `en`.

active.description: Whether the product version is active. Inactive provisioning artifacts are invisible to end users. End users cannot launch or update a provisioned product from an inactive provisioning artifact. Default is `true`.

createdTime.description: Time when the provisioning artifact was created.

description.description: Description of the provisioning artifact (i.e., version), including how it differs from the previous provisioning artifact.

disableTemplateValidation.description: Whether AWS Service Catalog stops validating the specified provisioning artifact template even if it is invalid.

guidance.description: Information set by the administrator to provide guidance to end users about which provisioning artifacts to use. Valid values are `DEFAULT` and `DEPRECATED`. The default is `DEFAULT`. Users are able to make updates to a provisioned product of a deprecated version but cannot launch new provisioned products using a deprecated version.

name.description: Name of the provisioning artifact (for example, `v1`, `v2beta`). No spaces are allowed.

templatePhysicalId.description: Template source as the physical ID of the resource that contains the template. Currently only supports CloudFormation stack ARN. Specify the physical ID as `arn:[partition]:cloudformation:[region]:[account ID]:stack/[stack name]/[resource ID]`.

templateUrl.description:
Template source as URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3.

The following arguments are optional:

type.description: Type of provisioning artifact. See [AWS Docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/servicecatalog/latest/dg/API_ProvisioningArtifactProperties.html) for valid list of values.

acceptLanguage.description: Language code. Valid values: `en` (English), `jp` (Japanese), `zh` (Chinese). The default value is `en`.

active.description: Whether the product version is active. Inactive provisioning artifacts are invisible to end users. End users cannot launch or update a provisioned product from an inactive provisioning artifact. Default is `true`.

description.description: Description of the provisioning artifact (i.e., version), including how it differs from the previous provisioning artifact.

disableTemplateValidation.description: Whether AWS Service Catalog stops validating the specified provisioning artifact template even if it is invalid.

guidance.description: Information set by the administrator to provide guidance to end users about which provisioning artifacts to use. Valid values are `DEFAULT` and `DEPRECATED`. The default is `DEFAULT`. Users are able to make updates to a provisioned product of a deprecated version but cannot launch new provisioned products using a deprecated version.

name.description: Name of the provisioning artifact (for example, `v1`, `v2beta`). No spaces are allowed.

templatePhysicalId.description: Template source as the physical ID of the resource that contains the template. Currently only supports CloudFormation stack ARN. Specify the physical ID as `arn:[partition]:cloudformation:[region]:[account ID]:stack/[stack name]/[resource ID]`.

templateUrl.description:
Template source as URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3.

The following arguments are optional:

type.description: Type of provisioning artifact. See [AWS Docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/servicecatalog/latest/dg/API_ProvisioningArtifactProperties.html) for valid list of values.
